intro: Phelipanche mutelii var. nana, commonly known as the dwarf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces trumpet-shaped flowers, typically in shades of purple or pink. The plant is characterized by its short stature and hairy stems, with small, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often found in Mediterranean regions and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
